intro: Enargea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered enargea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and have a hairy texture, contributing to its unique appearance. Enargea parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
